p: In this study, TIICs played a decisive role in the prognosis and survival of LUAD patients [ 26]. Therefore, we used TIMER database to further explore the relationship between the prognosis and survival of infiltrating immune cells and TUBA1C expression in LUAD tissues. As shown in Fig. 4a, b negative correlation exists between TUBA1C expression levels and the infiltrating level of B cells (r = − 0.331, P = 8.22e−14) and CD4+ T cells (r = − 0.2, P = 9.64e−06). In LUAD tissues, TUBA1C expression was associated with poor prognosis and high immune infiltration. As shown in Fig. 4c, the infiltrating level of B cell and TUBA1C expression were the factors related to the cumulative survival rate of LUAD.
